member.name: T:MAT.FFT
member.summary:
The FFT class provides a CLS compliant, MWArray interface to the MATLAB functions contained in the files:
F:\matlab\fsolvefun.m

member.name: M:MAT.FFT.#cctor
member.summary: The static constructor instantiates and initializes the MATLAB Runtime instance.

member.name: M:MAT.FFT.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the FFT class.

member.name: M:MAT.FFT.Finalize
member.summary: Class destructor called by the CLR garbage collector.

member.name: M:MAT.FFT.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the native resources associated with this object

member.name: M:MAT.FFT.fsolvefun
member.summary: Provides a single output, 0-input MWArrayinterface to the fsolvefun MATLAB function.
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

member.name: M:MAT.FFT.fsolvefun(MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray)
member.summary: Provides a single output, 1-input MWArrayinterface to the fsolvefun MATLAB function.
member.returns: An MWArray containing the first output argument.

member.name: M:MAT.FFT.fsolvefun(System.Int32)
member.summary: Provides the standard 0-input MWArray interface to the fsolvefun MATLAB function.
member.param: The number of output arguments to return.
member.returns: An Array of length "numArgsOut" containing the output arguments.

member.name: M:MAT.FFT.fsolvefun(System.Int32,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray)
member.summary: Provides the standard 1-input MWArray interface to the fsolvefun MATLAB function.
member.param: The number of output arguments to return.
member.returns: An Array of length "numArgsOut" containing the output arguments.

member.name: M:MAT.FFT.fsolvefun(System.Int32,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray[]@,MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray[])
member.summary: Provides an interface for the fsolvefun function in which the input and output arguments are specified as an array of MWArrays.
member.remarks: This method will allocate and return by reference the output argument array.
member.param: The number of output arguments to return

member.name: M:MAT.FFT.WaitForFiguresToDie
member.summary: This method will cause a MATLAB figure window to behave as a modal dialog box. The method will not return until all the figure windows associated with this component have been closed.
member.remarks: An application should only call this method when required to keep the MATLAB figure window from disappearing. Other techniques, such as calling Console.ReadLine() from the application should be considered where possible.
